info.title: IMN  API- DEV
info.description:
# The REST API of IMN system
## Overview
The REST APIs provide programmatic access to read and write IMN data. 
Basically, with this API you will be able to do everything like you were with your browser on https://go.imn.io !

The main features are:
- Register and manage your account
- Create and manage and share your stores with your friends/co-workers.
- Import your product catalog and schedule the auto importation
- Search the channels your want to use
- Configure your channels for your catalogs to export your product information:
    - cost and general settings
    - category and columns mappings
    - your will be able to create and manage your custom column
    - put in place exlusion filters based on simple conditions on your product data
    - override product values
    - get product vision for a channel catalog scope
- Analyze and optimize your performance of your catalogs on all yours channels with different type of reportings by day, channel, category and by product.
- Automatize your optimisation by using rules!
- And of course... Manage your orders harvested from all your marketplaces:
    - Synchronize your orders in an uniformized way
    - Get the available actions and update the order status
- ...and more!

## Authentication credentials
TBD

## Things to keep in mind
### API Rate Limits
- The IMN REST API is limited to 100 calls/minute.

### Media type
The default media type for requests and responses is application/json. Where noted, some operations support other content types. If no additional content type is mentioned for a specific operation, then the media type is application/json.

### Required content type
The required and default encoding for the request and responses is UTF8.

### Required date time format
All our date time are formatted in ISO 8601 format: 2014-06-24T16:25:00Z.

### Base URL
The Base URL of the IMN API Order Management REST API conforms to the following template.

https://api.imn.io

All URLs returned by the IMN API are relative to this base URL, and all requests to the REST API must use this base URL template.

You can test our API on https://api-docs.imn.io/swagger-ui\
You can contact us on [gitter, #IMN/API](https://gitter.im/IMN/API)

x-IMN-api-ops.comment: No change. Just server side generation.

get.summary: Get all actions you can do on the order API

post.summary: Get a paginated list of all Orders with all Order and Order Item(s) properties
post.description:
The purpose of this operation is to reduce the amount of request to the API.\
\
Previous implmentation of this feature only returned a partial (light) version of the Orders. The purpose of this API is to reduce the number of incoming requests by returning the complete (full) Order and Order Item(s) properties.

parameters.name: Accept-Encoding
parameters.description: Allows the client to indicate wether it accepts a compressed encoding to reduce traffic size

200.description: Successfully fetched the full list of Orders

400.description: Could not process request for given parameters values. Please check error message for more details.

head.summary: Get the meta information about the order (ETag, Last-Modified)
head.description:
The purpose of this operation is to reduce the bandwith usage by getting just the meta information about the order (ETag, Last-Modified) with the body.
This could be useful

200.description: Successfully fetched Order and Order Item(s) properties

For more details go to this link: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.2

For more details go to this link: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

merchantAccountIndexLinks.description:
The action you can do on the account API
The create and checkMerchantCode link will be available when the merchant code is not created
The account link will be available when the merchant has be created

apiToken.description: The api token that you will have to use to connect to our API

merchantAccountInfoLinks.description:
The action you can do on a merchant.
The external link will be avaible if there is no subscription requested

allOf.description:
The link to sales force form to easily subscribe to the marketplaces
The query string will be indicated by the server: 
- email: the email of the merchant
- merchantCode: The merchant code 
- hmac: Computed by the server with a shared secret key

beginPeriodUtcDate.description:
The begin period you want to make the search. \
The period MUST not be greater than 30 days.
The begin period MUST be lower than the end period.

endPeriodUtcDate.description:
The end period of you search. \
The period MUST not be greater than 30 days. \
The end period MUST be greater than the begin period.
The end period MUST be lower to the current date.

price.description: The shipping price of this order

tax.description: The shipping tax for this order

latestShipUtcDate.description: The UTC date of the latest ship for this order

customerIdentifier.description: The buyer identifier for this order

firstName.description: The first name of the person

lastName.description: The last name of the person

comment.description: The comment to access to this address

countryIsoCodeAlpha2.description: The address country iso code alpha 2 (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#/decoding_table for more details)

purchaseUtcDate.description: The purchase date of this order

marketplaceLastModificationUtcDate.description: The last modification UTC date done by the marketplace on this order

marketPlaceChannel.description: Useful to identify the origin of the order. For example in Cdiscount.

comment.description: The comment associated to this order

orderMarketplaceInfo.description: Describe the basic information related to an order.

totalPrice.description: The total price of this order (corresponding to the amount paid by the customer)

totalTax.description: The total tax of this order

totalCommission.description: The total commission of this order

additionalFee.description: Additional fee related to this order

paymentMethod.description: The payment method of this order

payingUtcDate.description: The UTC date of the payment of this order

orderMerchantInfo.description: The information that concerns the merchant for this order

allOf.description: Describe in details all informations related to an order.

imnLastModificationUtcDate.description: The last modification UTC date done by IMN of this order

merchantMarketplaceSubscriptionRefusalRe.description: The marketplace reason for the subscription's refusal

charge.description: The charge for this delivery mode considering the rule

additionalCharge.description: The additional charge for this delivery mode

source.description: If true, this marketplace is the source of offers

batchMerchantMarketplaceOfferChanges.description: Contains all changes for one marketplace for one merchant

price.description: The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes. http://schema.org/price

priceCurrency.description:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.
Usage guidelines:
Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. USD) instead of including ambiguous symbols such as $ in the value. http://schema.org/priceCurrency

validFrom.description: The date when the item becomes valid. http://schema.org/validFrom

validThrough.description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours. http://schema.org/validThrough

minPrice.description: The lowest price if the price is a range. http://schema.org/minPrice

deliveryLeadTime.description: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup. http://schema.org/deliveryLeadTime

inventoryLevel.description: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items. http://schema.org/inventoryLevel

fulfilledBy.description: The marketplace in charge of the delivery on this offer.

deliveryMethod.description: A delivery method is a standardized procedure for transferring the product or service to the destination of fulfillment chosen by the customer. Delivery methods are characterized by the means of transportation used, and by the organization or group that is the contracting party for the sending organization or person.

transportTime.description: To compute the shipping time, we sometimes ask for the typical delay from the moment the goods are either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup. http://schema.org/deliveryLeadTime

propertyName.description: The related property name causing the none importation of the offer

actualValue.description: The actual value causing the none importation of the offer

marketplaceStatus.description: Indicate the status of the marketplace

firstName.description: The first name of a person

lastName.description: The last name of a person

correlationId.description: The correlation identifier. It's a guid.

messageId.description: The message identifier. It's a guid.

causeId.description: The cause identifier. It's a guid.

merchantCode.description: The merchant code identifier in IMN

marketplaceCode.description:
The marketplace code identifier in IMN.
For now we have:
- C1 for Cdiscount
- E1 for ePrice
- R1 for Real.DE
- B1 for BOL
- E2 for eMAG

marketplaceMerchantCode.description: The merchant code for a marketplace

pageSize.description: Indicate the item count per page

categoryPath.description: Indicates on which catalog category path you want to make the filter
Indicates on which channel category path you want to make the filter

values.description:
Must be null if the operator is "IsNull" or "IsNotNull".
Can contains multiple value in case of "InList" operator. Otherwise a single value is expected.

additionalProductFilters.description:
Describe a filter on a product's column.
The key is the column identifier of your catalog or a custom column.

productFilterOperatorName.description: Indicate the operator you want to make on the columnId

sku.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers. http://schema.org/sku

gtin.description:
Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) of the item.
Supported values:

- UPC (in North America / GTIN-12)
12-digit number like 323456789012
8-digit UPC-E codes should be converted to 12-digit codes
- EAN (in Europe / GTIN-13)
13-digit number like 3001234567892
- JAN (in Japan / GTIN-13)
8 or 13-digit number like 49123456 or 4901234567894
- ISBN (for books)
10 or 13-digit number like 1455582344 or 978-1455582341. If you have both, only include the 13-digit number. ISBN-10 are deprecated and should be converted to ISBN-13
- ITF-14 (for multipacks / GTIN-14)
14-digit number like 10856435001702

Schema.org property:
- [Offer.gtin8](http://schema.org/gtin8)
- [Offer.gtin12](http://schema.org/gtin12)
- [Offer.gtin13](http://schema.org/gtin13)
- [Offer.gtin14](http://schema.org/gtin14)
- [Offer.isbn](http://schema.org/isbn)

productBasicInfo.description: The basic information related to a product

productExists.description: Indicates if the product still exists in your catalog

listOfValueItem.description: This object is used by LOV apis

href.description: Indicate the relative uri for this link

httpMethod.description: Indicate the http method to use on this link

label.description: The label corresponding to the link. This label is automatically translated based on the Accept-Language http header.

urlTemplated.description: indicates whether the href is templated or not

allRequiredParamsProvided.description: indicates whether all required params have been provided

allOptionalParamsProvided.description: indicates whether all optionals params have been provided

rel.description: Indicate the relation name related to the link

parameterIn.description:
* path: if the parameter must be pass in the path uri
* header: if the parameter must be passed in http header
* query: if the parameter must be passed in querystring
* body: if the parameter must be passed in the body
* file: if the parameter must be passed in a multipart/form-data (https://swagger.io/docs/specification/2-0/file-upload/)

parameterType.description: The value type of the parameter

label.description: The label corresponding to the link parameter. This label is automatically translated based on the Accept-Language http header.

value.description: The value of the parameter. It can be an integer a string or an object.

lovRequired.description: If true, you MUST indicate a value from the list of values otherwise it's a freetext

properties.description: If the parameter is an object with flexible properties (additionProperties/dictionary), we will describe the properties of the object.

validationPattern.description: The regular expression to validate the value

label.description: The label corresponding to the link parameter property. This label is automatically translated based on the Accept-Language http header.

value.description: The value of the parameter. It can be an integer a string or an object.

lovRequired.description: If true, you MUST use indicate a value from the list of values otherwise it's a freetext

lovLink.description: This parameter expect the values indicated in this list of values.

lovRequired.description: If true, you MUST use indicate a value from the list of values otherwise it's a freetext

listName.description: The name of the list of value

href.description: Indicate the uri to the list of value

docUrl.description: The documentation related to this operation.

message.example: There is already an importation in progress: b24d0dd8-a561-478a-9b26-34f573f03527

x-tagGroups.name: External API - Merchant Marketplace Subscription Request
tags: External API - Merchant Marketplace Subscription Request - Global

userNameInQueryParameter.name: userName
userNameInQueryParameter.description: Sometimes the user in the e-commerce application is not the same as user associated with the current subscription key. We recommend providing your application's user login.

testModeInQueryParameter.name: testMode
testModeInQueryParameter.description: If true, the operation will be not be sent to marketplace. But the validation will be taken in account.

pageNumberQueryStringParameter.name: pageNumber
pageNumberQueryStringParameter.description: The page number you want to get

pageSizeQueryStringParameter.name: pageSize
pageSizeQueryStringParameter.description: The entry count you want to get

ifNoneMatchParameter.name: If-None-Match
ifNoneMatchParameter.description:
ETag value to identify the last known version of requested resource.\
To avoid useless exchange, we recommend you to indicate the ETag you previously got from this operation.\
If the ETag value does not match the response will be 200 to give you a new content, otherwise the response will be: 304 Not Modified, without any content.\
For more details go to this link: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

ifMatchParameter.name: If-Match
ifMatchParameter.description:
ETag value to identify the last known version of requested resource.\
To ensure that you are making a change on the lastest version of the resource.\
For more details go to this link: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

acceptLanguageParameter.name: Accept-Language
acceptLanguageParameter.description: Indicates that the client accepts the following languages.

acceptEncodingRequiredParameter.name: Accept-Encoding
acceptEncodingRequiredParameter.description: Allows the client to indicate wether it accepts a compressed encoding to reduce traffic size.

acceptEncodingOptionalParameter.name: Accept-Encoding
acceptEncodingOptionalParameter.description: Allows the client to indicate wether it accepts a compressed encoding to reduce traffic size.

304_NotModified.description: The ETag sent in the http header If-None-Match did not change. So you are up to date !

Last-Modified.description:
Last modification UTC date of the resource\
For more details go to this link: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.2

ETag.description:
ETag value to identify the current version of the resource\
For more details go to this link: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

412_PreConditionFailed.description: The ETag sent in the http header If-Match did not match with the current version. Please refresh the information related to this resource.

ETag.description:
The ETag value to identify the resource.\
For more details go to this link: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

merchantNotFound.description: The merchant code is not found.

marketplaceNotFound.description: The marketplace code is not found.

merchantOrMarketplaceNotFound.description: The merchant code or marketplace code is not found.

merchantCodeAlreadyUsed.description: The merchant code is not available

invalidMerchantCode.description: The merchant code is different from the state

notOfferSourceMarketplace.description: The marketplace is not the offer source

subscriptionNotAccepted.description: The subscription is not accepted by the marketplace

credentialNotConfigured.description: The credential is not configured for the marketplace
